Refunds:

A processing fee may apply to refund requests initiated by attendees. Refunds will be processed within 2 business days after approval.

Cancellations:

Attendees must notify the organizers of any cancellations at least 2 days before the event date. Cancellations made after the specified deadline may not be eligible for a refund. The organizers reserve the right to cancel or reschedule the event due to unforeseen circumstances. In such cases, attendees will be notified promptly, and refunds will be issued accordingly.

Transfer of Tickets:

Tickets are non-transferable without prior approval from the organizers. Requests for ticket transfers must be made in writing and approved by the organizers.

No-show Policy:

Attendees who do not show up for the event without prior notice will not be eligible for a refund. By registering for the event, attendees agree to abide by the refund and cancellation policy outlined above. The organizers reserve the right to amend or update this policy as necessary.

document.short_description:
Letterpress Printmaking Workshop by PRINTING WITH TYPES


Come & Experience the art of letterpress with us at love OORU, a cosy rooftop located at Koramangala. A bespoke workshop to get to know about letterpress - history, process and craft of printing by hand on an antique press. The session will focus on hand setting the metal type the old fashioned way, making a composition and printing your own piece of typographic art.


- Beginner level workshop. 

- No prior experience needed. 

- All tools would be provided for use only.


- Printed article can be carried along, materials and types will be provided for workshop use only - not to take home.

document.short_description:
Unwine'd by The Blend Community


Date: 22nd - 23rd June  

Timings: 11am – 10pm  

Venue: Pebbles, Bangalore   


Pouring Over the Details: 

Join us for Unwine'd, an exclusive wine festival in Bangalore that promises an immersive experience with multiple wines from across the globe. Delight in unique wine styles, regional offerings, and exquisite gourmet food pairings. This vibrant event is filled with themed activities, fun games, and live entertainment. Each attendee receives a beautiful wine glass souvenir and tasting coupons for all showcased wines. Engage with fellow wine enthusiasts, partake in educational workshops, and create unforgettable memories.


Highlights:

- Wine Tastings: Sample a diverse range of wines from local and international vineyards.

- Gourmet Pairings: Enjoy artisanal cheeses, chocolates, and gourmet foods.

- Live Music: Dance and relax to foot-tapping music.

- Workshops & Seminars: Learn from wine experts in engaging sessions.

- Artisanal Crafts: Explore handcrafted goods and wine accessories.

- Relaxation Zones: Unwind in scenic, comfortable seating areas.


Special Experiences:

- Grape Stomping: Channel your inner winemaker.

- DIY Wine Cocktails: Create custom wine-based drinks.

- Celebrity Chef's Tables: Enjoy culinary journeys with renowned chefs.

- Wine Blending: Craft your unique wine blend.


Join us at Unwine'd for a celebration of wine, culture, and community. Let the future speak wine!

document.name: Carnival 2.0 - An exclusive Taste & Buy affair

custom_questions.question: Where did you hear about us?

document.short_description:
The Wine Community BLR is a group of young wine enthusiasts keen on uplifting the wine scene in the city. We believe in breaking age-old stereotypes whilst making wine approachable, interesting and fun for all. After 21 successful themed chapters since the group’s inception in 2022, we are excited to be hosting our 22nd chapter in all its glory for a much larger crowd in the city with Carnival 2.0!

Check out our Instagram handle @winecommunityblr to get an overview of what we have accomplished over the last 21 months. We are as excited as you are and look forward to seeing you at our Carnival in June. Cheers!


Participating Brands:


Domestic Producers:

  1. Big Banyan Wines
  2. Fratelli Wines
  3. Grover Zampa Vineyards
  4. KRSMA Estates
  5. Sula Vineyards
  6. Talisva Winery

Importers - International Producers:

  1. Anggel's Share
  2. Brindco
  3. Chenab Alcobev
  4. Gusto Wines
  5. Monika Alcobev
  6. Sonarys
  7. Tetrad Global Beverages
  8. Wine Park

﻿

Highlights

  • Timings for the Carnival 2.0 on 9th of June are from 3pm - 10pm.
  • It is an exclusive “Taste & Buy” affair with a beautiful selection of both Indian & Imported wines.
  • Each ticket holder will be offered a wine glass at the entry.
  • We request each attendee to hold on to this glass for use throughout their time at the Carnival 2.0, as there will be no replacements.
  • A ticket holder will receive coupons at the time of their entry to access all wine stalls. This includes one coupon per wine stall, against all participating brands.
  • Each coupon represents the wine brands/ the wines being offered at each counter and offers you a tasting pour of wines from the respective brand’s counter.
  • Attendees can also purchase wines at a flat 25% discount on their MRPs at the Carnival 2.0. This special offer is valid for purchases at the venue only on the 9th June.
  • Upon entry, each ticket holder will also receive two food coupons in denominations of Rs 250/- which can be redeemed at the exclusive food counter, offering a delectable variety from The PARK Bangalore.
  • Additional food items can be purchased at exciting prices & paid for directly at the counter.


We have a line up of exciting sessions for the curious minded folks. Feel free to sign up for any of the 4 sessions that we have in store from some of the most prominent personnel.


PLEASE CLICK ANY OF THE BELOW LINKS TO FIND YOUR WAY TO AN EXCITING SESSION ON WINES THAT DAY:

  1. Learn About Wine - A comparative guidance to WSET & CMS credentials
  2. Almost famous by Ruma Singh (DipWSET)
  3. Wine 101: Tarini Kumar (Founder, Wine In a Million)
  4. Influence of Oak in Winemaking - Gaurav Thapar (Karnataka Grape & Wine Board)


Our trusted media partner will be ARB STUDIOS who also has judiciously covered the last 21 chapters for us. Check out @architrb on Instagram to browse through some of the fabulous work they do.

document.short_description:
Pasta Shop at The Conservatory!


Our glasshouse is transforming into a pasta shop for just two days. Experience pastas like never before from our menu featuring different types of handcrafted pastas curated by Chef Goku.


Chef Goku is a graduate of The Culinary Institute of America. He has worked at Dominique Ansel Bakery, Aureole, The Clock Tower, Junoon, Rezdora in New York, and Blackbird in Chicago. Currently, he conducts pop-ups and curated dinners in Chennai under the brand name Hygge By Chef Goku. Additionally, he oversees the pastry kitchens Chokolat Culture and Maison Indulgence.


MENU FOR THE PASTA SHOP


ANTIPASTI

document.booking_confirmation_message:
We can't wait to meet you at Sip & Read! The venue is C+C's gorgeous new space called, "The Studio". In case you're unable to locate, it's right above "Chakra Athletica". It's in the 4th floor of the building that houses Brush and Blush Salon.


Please arrive promptly at 5 PM, so we can spend an hour of silent reading. We'll have our own library of books for you to choose from. Or you can get your books too. All food is plant-based and all beverages are non-alcoholic.


Come with a gentle appetite and an open mind to meeting new people. Leave your phones to rest, so that you can unwind in the company of other like-minded folks.


There is very limited parking in nearby side streets so please take a cab if possible. We also don't have valet parking.


About Bookmark App: It is India's first-ever dating app for readers founded by the same folks who started Cubbon Reads! Your DP remains hidden until you match with someone and exchange ten messages with them. While books and reading interests become the core connecting point, it also matches people through the base location, the relationship status, gender preferences, and more.


About The Studio by Copper+Cloves: A new community space in Indiranagar, Bangalore. It will be hosting events every weekend, and yoga, sound healing, pilates and more on most other days. The in-house cafe will be your loved Copper+Cloves.

document.short_description:
Fruits & Vegetables with Chefs Ria Beliappa & Karan Upmanyu


To celebrate The Conservatory, which has fostered experimentation and creative expression through food for the last two years, we bring you another unconventional dining experience.


Taking inspiration from its botanical setting, modelled after the Lal Bagh greenhouse, this menu plays with the forms and flavours of fruits and vegetables.

 

In our daily lives we use vegetables for savoury dishes, and focus on fruits for sweeter things. This menu aims to challenge that status quo in a fun and playful manner - fruits for dinner and vegetables for dessert!


“Contra la Corriente”


FRUITS & VEGETABLES


FRUITS 


Cherry & Bitter Orange

Loafer’s Seedy Sour Cherry Mostarda, Bitter Orange & Cinnamon Butter


Melon 

Serrano Ham, Melon & Sherry Jelly. 


Mango 

Red Snapper Ceviche, Pickled Mangoes, Mango Leche de Tigre. 


Passion Fruit 

Squid & Prawn, Green Chilli - Passion Fruit Emulsion.


Pineapple

Koji glazed Pork Belly, Pineapple Salsa. 


Apricots, Preserved Lemons & Dates

Lamb Tagine Roulade, Whipped Feta & Braised Fennel. 



VEGETABLES 


Cauliflower

Dulce de Leche, Dill & Walnut. 


Potato 

Chocolate, Bay Leaf, Thyme & Orange 


Beetroot

Caramel, Hazelnut & Brownie.

document.name: 'Spirited Away' Movie Screening | Family Movie Night
document.short_description:
Family Movie Night: World Cinema for Kids!


Join us as we watch a series of carefully curated rare masterpieces from around the world, made just for kids. Watch this while cozying up with your family at the studio.


"Spirited Away" is a Japanese animated fantasy film written and directed by Hayao Miyazaki, produced by Studio Ghibli, and released in 2001. The story follows a 10-year-old girl named Chihiro Ogino who becomes trapped in a mysterious and magical world of spirits while moving to a new neighborhood.


Event Highlights

Broaden Horizons with Global Tales: Dive into diverse artistic expressions through rare masterpieces curated for children. Cultivate Cultural Curiosity: Spark interest in world cinema and inspire exploration of different cultures through film's enchantment. Quality Family Bonding: Embark on a cinematic journey to a new country each month, forging lasting memories and strengthening family connections.


Why Attend?

Uncover Hidden Treasures: Discover lesser-known gems handpicked for their artistic brilliance and captivating storytelling. Artistic Excellence: Immerse your child in films of unparalleled artistic merit, fueling their imagination and creativity. Safe Family Environment: Enjoy movies in a secure, family-friendly setting, ensuring a worry-free experience for kids and parents alike.


Don't miss this opportunity to create lasting memories with your family while exposing your kids to the wonders of world cinema. Join us for Family Movie Night – where the magic of storytelling knows no bounds!

document.cancellation_policy:
Refunds:

Refunds will be issued only in cases where the event is cancelled by the organizers. Refund requests made by attendees will be considered up to 2 days prior to the event date. A processing fee may apply to refund requests initiated by attendees. Refunds will be processed within 2 business days after approval.

Cancellations:

Attendees must notify the organizers of any cancellations at least 2 days before the event date. Cancellations made after the specified deadline may not be eligible for a refund. The organizers reserve the right to cancel or reschedule the event due to unforeseen circumstances. In such cases, attendees will be notified promptly, and refunds will be issued accordingly.

Transfer of Tickets:

Tickets are non-transferable without prior approval from the organizers. Requests for ticket transfers must be made in writing and approved by the organizers.
